org.multigraph
Class DatetimeFormatter

java.lang.Object
  org.multigraph.DataFormatter
      org.multigraph.DatetimeFormatter

public class DatetimeFormatter
extends DataFormatter

The DatetimeFormatter converts DatetimeValues to strings, according to a format pattern.

Constructor Detail

DatetimeFormatter

public DatetimeFormatter(java.lang.String format)
Create a new DatetimeFormatter with a given format string. The format string can contain any of the following conversion codes:

CodeConverts To
%dDay without leading zeros
%DDay with leading zeros (2 digits)
%mMonth (numerical) without leading zeros
%MMonth (numerical, 2 digits) with leading zeros
%YFour digit year
%yTwo digit year
%WWeekday name (spelled out completely, like "Monday", etc)
%wWeekday name, 3-letter abbreviation
%NMonth name (spelled out completely, like "January", etc)
%nMonth name -- 3 letter abbreviation
%Hhours, 00-24 hours, 2 digits
%hhours, 0-12 hours
%iMinutes (2 digits)
%sSeconds (2 digits)
%vdeciseconds -- 10ths of second -- 1 char
%Vcentiseconds -- 100ths of second -- 2 chars
%qmilliseconds -- 3 chars
%PAM or PM
%pam or pm
%Lnewline
%%a single % character

Parameters:
format - The format string for this formatter.
Method Detail

format

public java.lang.String format(DataValue value)
Convert a given value to a string according to the conversion determined by this DatetimeFormatter's format string.

Specified by:
format in class DataFormatter
Parameters:
value - The value to be converted
Returns:
The formatted String

getMaxLength

public int getMaxLength()
Description copied from class: DataFormatter
Return the maximum string length of strings (typically) returned by this DataFormatter. This may be an estimate and might not include lengths generated by unusually large values.

Specified by:
getMaxLength in class DataFormatter
Returns:
The maximum string length.
